intro: Lesquerella geyeri, commonly known as the desert lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Lesquerella geyeri produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds used in traditional medicine and as a source of oils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential agricultural applications.
